Class Client

  • java.lang.Object
    • Client

  • public class Client
extends java.lang.Object
    Group Chat Client. Also contains data on chat client to be shared across threads. Contains data structure of other chat members, the messages received, and the knowledge of which user has which messages. Contains references to relevant threads / runnables, so for example the Receiver of control packets can indirectly call a method on the Sender.

    • Method Detail

      • beLoud

        public void beLoud()
        Make sure everyone knows I exist Give them my IP and ports so they know how to get in touch with me. Do this by sending to their data ports, with TCP, to make sure they get the message. This should be called before starting other threads, so don't need to synchronize.

      • requestGroupInfo

        public Group requestGroupInfo(java.lang.String groupName,
                     java.net.InetAddress serverAddress,
                     int serverPort)
                       throws java.io.IOException
        Sends server request for group info.
        Parameters:
        groupName - name of group requested to join
        serverAddress - IP address of server to request
        serverPort - Port on server to request from
        username - client's requested name.
        Returns:
        Group to be a part of.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • startMessaging

        public void startMessaging()
        Starts the P2P Group Chat process. Reads lines from standard input and sends them to everyone.

      • getCurrentIP

        public java.net.InetAddress getCurrentIP()
        Get the current IP of your machine. Iterates over the machines, IP addresses and finds the public facing IP.

      • serverRequest

        public byte[] serverRequest(java.lang.String groupName)
        Parameters:
        chatName - The name of the chat to look for.
        Returns:
        Byte array to send over the wire.
